title: C04-1036

sentences.text: We suggest a new goal and evaluation criterion for word similarity measures .

The new criterion -- meaning-entailing substitutability -- fits the needs of semantic-oriented NLP applications and can be evaluated directly -LRB- independent of an application -RRB- at a good level of human agreement .

Motivated by this semantic criterion we analyze the empirical quality of distributional word feature vectors and its impact on word similarity results , proposing an objective measure for evaluating feature vector quality .
Finally , a novel feature weighting and selection function is presented , which yields superior feature vectors and better word similarity performance .

Entity-meaning-entailing_substitutabilit.label: meaning-entailing substitutability
Entity-meaning-entailing_substitutabilit.description: A semantic criterion for evaluating word similarity measures, which assesses whether two words can be substituted with each other in a sentence without changing its meaning.

Entity-a_new_goal_and_evaluation_criteri.description: A novel approach to evaluating the quality of word similarity measures, introducing a semantic-based goal and corresponding criteria.

summary: We suggest a new goal and evaluation criterion for word similarity measures . The new criterion -- meaning-entailing substitutability -- fits the needs of semantic-oriented NLP applications and can be evaluated directly -LRB- independent of an application -RRB- at a good level of human agreement . Motivated by this semantic criterion we analyze the empirical quality of distributional word feature vectors and its impact on word similarity results , proposing an objective measure for evaluating feature vector quality . Finally , a novel feature weighting and selection function is presented , which yields superior feature vectors and better word similarity performance .

Predicate-propose.label: propose
Predicate-propose.description: To propose means to formally present or recommend an idea, plan, or solution as a viable option for consideration. The predicate connects the subject (the entity making the proposal) with the object (the proposed concept or course of action), indicating that the subject is putting forth their suggestion in a deliberate and intentional manner.

Predicate-fits.label: fits
Predicate-fits.description: Indicates that a subject has a specific property or characteristic that matches or corresponds to an object. The predicate 'fits' suggests a sense of compatibility, relevance, or suitability between the subject and object.

Predicate-motivates.label: motivates
Predicate-motivates.description: To motivate something means to give it direction or purpose, often by providing a compelling reason or incentive. In this sense, the predicate 'motivates' establishes a causal link between the subject and object, suggesting that the subject's presence or influence leads to the emergence of the object as a goal-oriented entity.

Predicate-has_an_impact_on.label: has an impact on
Predicate-has_an_impact_on.description: The predicate 'has an impact on' indicates a causal relationship between the subject (an entity or concept) and the object (another entity or concept), suggesting that the subject's presence, influence, or effect contributes to or alters the state of the object. In general, this predicate implies a directional connection where changes in the subject can be observed in the object.

Predicate-analyze.label: analyze
Predicate-analyze.description: To examine or investigate a subject's properties, characteristics, or relationships with an object to gain insight into their nature, behavior, or effects.

Predicate-presents.label: presents
Predicate-presents.description: The predicate 'presents' indicates a relationship of introduction or offering between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject provides or makes available the object, often implying a sense of novelty, innovation, or uniqueness.

Predicate-present.label: present
Predicate-present.description: The predicate 'present' indicates that a specific concept or idea (the object) exists or occurs simultaneously with another entity or state of affairs (the subject). It suggests a co-occurrence, relevance, or manifestation of the object within the context defined by the subject.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: Indicates that the subject concept is more specific than or subsumed by the object concept.
